page.title: 07TRANSPORT 1
page.content: Carrington is practically isolated and it is essential to have a car, but if you are unlucky enough not to, this could become a problem. The post office runs a 'post bus' service but this is a problem as the bus leaves Carrington at 11.00 am and takes passengers to Gorebridge.They then have one hour to hang around as the bus returns at 1.00 pm. Rosewell has a main bus service running through it and a bus comes every 30 - 35 mins taking passengers to Bonnyrigg,Dalkeith and Edinburgh. The 1981 census illustrates the contrast between local bus services and the need for private cars in the two communities.
